trans-unit.source: Upload images to Azure Blob storage from a universal Windows app | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Upload images to Azure Blob storage from a universal Windows app | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use a .NET backend mobile service to upload images to Azure Blob Storage and access the images from your universal Windows app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use a .NET backend mobile service to upload images to Azure Blob Storage and access the images from your universal Windows app.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Services to enable your app to upload and store user-generated images in Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses a SQL Database to store data.

trans-unit.source: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.
trans-unit.target: However, binary large object (BLOB) data is more efficiently stored in Azure Blob storage service.

trans-unit.source: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot securely distribute with the client app the credentials required to securely upload data to the Blob Storage service.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you must store these credentials in your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you must store these credentials in your mobile service and use them to generate a Shared Access Signature (SAS) that is used to upload a new image.

trans-unit.source: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.
trans-unit.target: The SAS, a credential with a short expiration—in this case 5 minutes, is returned securely by Mobile Services to the client app.

trans-unit.source: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.
trans-unit.target: The app then uses this temporary credential to upload the image.

trans-unit.source: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.
trans-unit.target: In this example, downloads from the Blob service are public.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial you add functionality to the Mobile Services quickstart app to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial you add functionality to the Mobile Services quickstart app to take pictures and upload the images to Azure by using an SAS generated by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Update 3, or a later version.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013 Update 3, or a later version.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage account</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage account</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: A camera or other image capture device attached to your computer.
trans-unit.target: A camera or other image capture device attached to your computer.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Now that you have been able to securely upload images by integrating your mobile service with the Blob service, check out some of the other backend service and integration topics:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have been able to securely upload images by integrating your mobile service with the Blob service, check out some of the other backend service and integration topics:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Schedule backend jobs in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Schedule backend jobs in Mobile Services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Mobile Services job scheduler functionality to define server script code that is executed on a schedule that you define.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Mobile Services job scheduler functionality to define server script code that is executed on a schedule that you define.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with .NET
